page.title: 13POPULATION AT SANDHEAD
page.content: The population of our block is concentrated in the village of Sandhead - less than half of a square kilometre containing almost all the population! In the surrounding countryside the remaining people are to be found on the farms or caravan sites where they work, or in farm cottages no longer needed for farm labourers, these people being either retired or employed in Stranraer. The village has a population of just over 200. In May 1984 a 5th Year pupil of Stranraer Academy, Sylvia Bruton, found the village population to be 219, and VERY HEAVILY WEIGHTED IN THE OVER 60s AGE GROUP. The exodus of young people from the district has shown in the school role, which has fallen from 170 in 1973 to 78 at the present. Mechanisation of farm methods has cut the workforce 30% to 50%.
